citation.article-title: Identification of Acetobacter strains isolated from Indonesian sources, and proposals of Acetobacter syzygii sp. nov., Acetobacter cibinongensis sp. nov., and Acetobacter orientalis sp. nov.
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Description of Acetobacter orientalis sp. nov.
Acetobacter orientalis (o.ri.en'ta.lis. M. L. adj. orientalis "oriental," referring to the region where the strains were isolated)
Cells are Gram-negative rods measuring from 0.6 to 0.8 by 2.0–3.0 μm, and mostly motile with peritrichous flagella.
Colonies are circular, convex, glistening, and non-pigmented.

Positive for catalase, oxidation of ethanol to acetic acid, oxidation of acetate and lactate to carbon dioxide and water, growth at 20 to 37°C, at pH 3.5 to 8.0, in the presence of 0.35% acetic acid (pH 3.5), in the presence of 5% D-glucose, and in the presence of 2 to 7% ethanol, production of D-gluconate and 2-keto-Dgluconate from D-glucose, and acid production from Dglucose, ethanol, and n-propanol.
Weakly positive for growth at 42°C, at pHs 3.0 and 9.0, in the presence of 20% D-glucose, and in the presence of 10% ethanol.
Variable for acid production from L-arabinose, D-xylose, D-galactose, and D-mannose.

Negative for oxidase, gelatinase, reduction of nitrate, production of cellulose, water soluble-brown pigment, H2S, indole, ammonia from L-arginine, and γ-pyrones from both D-glucose and D-fructose, production of 5-keto-D-gluconate and 2,5-diketo-D-gluconate from D-glucose, ketogenesis from glycerol, growth in the presence of 30% D-glucose and in the presence of 15% ethanol, and acid production from D-fructose, Lsorbose, D-arabinose, L-rhamnose, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol, glycerol, trehalose, sucrose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, raffinose, dulcitol, methanol, and starch.
DNA base composition ranges from 52.0 to 52.8 mol%.
Isolation sources are canna flower, fruits (starfruit and coconut), and traditional fermented foods (curd of tofu and tempe) in Indonesia.
The type strain is 21F-2T (=NRIC 0481T=IFO 16606T=JCM 11195T), and was isolated from canna flower (Canna hybrida), of which the G+C content is 52.3 mol%
